sentences.english: Two boats managed to get away and eventually hit upon the desert island of Trebucket .
sentences.chinese: 兩條小艇離開了沉船，最後來到特里巴克特這座荒島。

sentences.english: Most of us have formed an unrealistic picture of life on a desret island.
sentences.chinese: 我們許多人對於荒島生活都抱着一種不切實際的想法。

sentences.english: On the way to the island, he would pull in the oars and just let the boat drift where it wished, for hours at a time.
sentences.chinese: 在去荒島的途中，他會撤了漿任由小舟隨波逐流。

sentences.english: This desert island is a beautiful land of silence and space.
sentences.chinese: 這個荒島是一片美麗的地地，沉寂，遼闊。

sentences.english: They were cast away on a desert island without food or water.
sentences.chinese: 他們漂流到一個荒島上，既無食物，也沒有水喝。

sentences.english: Mount Desert Island in Acadia National Park is one of the most famous.
sentences.chinese: 在阿卡迪亞國家公園的山脈荒島是最著名的公園之一。

sentences.english: Or better still, move to isolated island.
sentences.chinese: 再不然，搬到荒島去好了。

sentences.english: We sometimes imagine a desert island to be a sort of paradise where the sun always shines.
sentences.chinese: 我仧有時想象荒島是陽光織日普照癿夛埻。

sentences.english: It is out of the question to live on this island.
sentences.chinese: 在那荒島上是不可能存活的。

sentences.english: Defoe vividly narrated the adventures of robinson crusoe on his desert island .
sentences.chinese: 笛福生動地敘述了魯浜遜克魯索在荒島上的冒險故事。

sentences.english: The survivors were stranded on a desolate island.
sentences.chinese: 生還者受困在一個杳無人煙的荒島上。

sentences.english: Thousands of threads like glass, formed of fluid lava, fell like rain upon the island.
sentences.chinese: 上萬條玻璃絲似的岩漿，雨點般地落在荒島上。

sentences.english: He could subsist on bark and grass roots in the isolated island.
sentences.chinese: 在荒島上他只能靠樹皮和草根維持生命。

definition: to suffer untold hardships (idiom); trials and tribulations/with difficulty/after some effort
to pass over mountains ridges (idiom); fig. hardships of the journey
foreign land/a place far from home
to leave one's native place, esp. against one's will (idiom)
to set up a vendor's stall in the street
bored to death (idiom)/bored stiff/overcome with boredom
homeless and miserable (idiom); to wander about in a desperate plight/to drift
